intro: Argostemma grandiflorum var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered argostemma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically pink or red, with five lobes, and bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
